poem:
Title: "To the Powers That Smother"

Men of iron yield to corporate suits,
cut the red heart from a laborer's chest.
In shrouded courts, union roots are quenched, 
while justice—the blind Dove—invests
in lead and feathers, in a hawk's nest.
Oh, speak not to me of watchdogs or rights,
when wolves wear the mantle of the undefiled knight.
